name: taylor swift granny dress
notes:

the taylor swift dress is all the rage, and i love this quick and fun garment project. 

**this pattern includes:

[a video tutorial][1]
- 5 length options
- size-inclusive xs-5x
- use any weight of yarn with the additional guide.
- stitch chart
- color inspiration (including the taylor swift dress coloring)
- diagrams for each section to easily understand the construction**

a stunning dress inspired by the iconic style of taylor swift! this pattern is perfect for both beginners and advanced crocheters. featuring the timeless granny stitch that is not only visually appealing but also fun and relaxing to work with. 

the easy construction of this dress allows you to create a chic and stylish garment with minimal effort, making it an enjoyable and rewarding from start to finish. 

whether you're a swiftie looking to replicate her fabulous look or simply searching for a delightful crochet project, this dress will become a favorite in your handmade wardrobe.

crochet hook:
[k (6.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][2]

notations:
[removable stitch marker][3]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][4]
[scissors][5]

yarn:
[caron blossom cakes][6]
61% cotton, 39% acrylic, 481 yds/8 0z
colorway shown: radiant rainbow
weight: 4 heavy worsted

with the guide, any weight of yarn can be used, some suggested yarns that go with the color inspiration charts are:

[wecrochet comfy worsted][7]
75% pima cotton, 25% acrylic, 109yds/50g

[wecrochet wonderfluff][8]
70% baby alpaca, 7% merino wool, 23% nylon, 142 yds/50 g

[hobbii cascata][9]
61% cotton, 39% premium acrylic, 437 yds/200 g

[hobbii portobello][10]
60% cotton, 28% acrylic, 12% wool, 131 yds/ 50 g

[lion brand color theory][11]
100% acrylic, 246yds/100g

yardage:
1050 (1200, 1300, 1400, 1500) 1650, 1800, 1950, 2100) yds
3 (3, 3, 3, 4) (4, 4, 4, 5) cakes in caron blossom

abbreviations
blo - back loop only
ch - chain
dc - double crochet
[stsc - stacked single crochet][12]
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)

gauge:
11 sts and 6.5 rows + 4" by 4" worked in the granny stitch.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][13]

sizes:
xs (s, m, l, 1x) (2x, 3x, 4x, 5x)
to fit chest:
30 (34, 38, 42, 46) (50, 54, 58, 62)
finished bust measurement:
34 (38, 42, 46, 50) (54, 58, 62, 64)
ease:
this garment is meant to be worn with a
3-5 inch ease.

skill level:
beginner
